project.teaser: Two major issues of secondary lines rail transport are need to change the train for many destinations and to be bound to a timetable. Pods can be used to adopt rail transport better to the users demand by higher flexibility and efficiency as well as realising on-demand rail...
project.objective: Two major issues of secondary lines rail transport are need to change the train for many destinations and to be bound to a timetable. Pods can be used to adopt rail transport better to the users demand by higher flexibility and efficiency as well as realising on-demand rail transport. The Project Pods4Rail aims to develop a concept for Pods and Pod-Carriers on Railway in order show the approach. Pod-carriers are serving as a moving infrastructure and the pods are loaded and locked on them for the transport. The main focus in Pods4Rail is the rail pod-carrier, which is presented in detail. Nevertheless, Pod-Carrier for Road and Ropeways are taken into consideration on a conceptual level to ensure the transferability of the concept. Related use cases and business cases are identified and analysed.
project.title: Concept Development of a System for Pods and Pod-Carriers to be used as Moving Infrastructures mainly for Rail, but as well for Road and Ropeways

result.title: Legislative and normative framework analysis
result.description: This deliverable will provide:•Consideration of the design definitions coming from the general overall specification in the WP2 •A review of laws and norms fitting with the design and potential operation is performed

result.title: Description of use cases
result.description: This deliverable will provide:·A description of the use cases ·A documentation on use case model

result.title: Evaluation / Benchmark of available and conceptional multi-modal mobility systems
result.description: This deliverable will provide:·A technical evaluation of multi-modal transport systems ·Evaluation of the multi-modal mobility system from various perspectives, including user, technological, environmental, and economical perspective.

result.title: Proposition for an evolution of the existing safety framework and preliminary safety requirements
result.description: This deliverable will provide:•Investigation of potential risks and various design options are studied•Potential normative evolution is studied. Doing this, separated sets of safety requirements are provided

result.title: Written report of the definition of multi-modal mobility systems
result.description: This deliverable will provide:•The results of the qualitative study including implications for the development of the multimodal mobility system, incl. general overall specification with description of needed technologies.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

category.title: HORIZON JU Research and Innovation Actions
category.description: HORIZON JU Research and Innovation Actions
